intro: Oncosiphon sabulosus, commonly known as the sand-plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
